byline.contributor: Christopher Mele contributed reporting. Giovanni Russonello contributed research.
byline.original: By PATRICK HEALY and JEREMY W. PETERS

abstract: American political establishment reels in response to election of Donald Trump as president; thousands of people take to streets in number of cities to protest, while millions of other voters celebrate election of true political outsider.
lead_paragraph: Democrats were particularly crestfallen that Hillary Clinton had a slender lead in the popular vote but lost in the Electoral College, a fate similar to Al Gore’s in 2000.
snippet: Democrats were particularly crestfallen that Hillary Clinton had a slender lead in the popular vote but lost in the Electoral College, a fate similar to Al Gore’s in 2000....

headline.main: Donald Trump’s Victory Is Met With Shock Across a Wide Political Divide
headline.print_headline: Democrats, Students and Foreign Allies Face the Reality of a Trump Presidency
